author: {'steamid': '76561198064156780', 'num_games_owned': 2860, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1674005662}
review: As for somebody who doesn't really play arcade puzzlers, this was challenging but not too hard. Even if it took far too many hours to finish. I would say its biggest downside is the grid/block based movement which started to feel worse and worse the more I progressed, you have to react fast in some levels so it became my downfall often enough. 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994487037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1665445431}
review:
I was a big fan of the C64 Boulder Dash games way back in the day, and while Pushcat has figured out a way to put an interesting twist on that style of game, I think it puts emphasis on the wrong things.

Most notably, there's a significant element of randomness to the majority of levels, whether it's random gem layouts or random block spawners, PushCat leans far more into its Match-3 elements rather than being a tightly-designed puzzle game.

The subsequent effect is that the levels all feel very 'samey', in that they tend to ultimately boil down to shifting a large pile of gems and rocks around, pushing rocks into the gutter and matching gems so that you can pick them up. If the level features infinite spawners, the gem target is obnoxiously large and tedious. If the level features a finite-but-RNG amount of gems, the gem target tends to be underwhelming and doesn't promote careful thought-out play. It's only the handful of fixed-layout levels that are actually any good.

Which is a shame because I think there are a lot of cool ideas here that I would want to see put into a really tightly-packed puzzle game, but this isn't it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009940296', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1694909263}
review: Uno de los primeros juegos Flash que compré en Steam. Definitivamente es un juego bueno, copia de Supaplex pero con su toque original. Tiene un problema y es que se abandonó ya hace varios años, entonces, tiene ciertos problemas con las nuevas funciones de Steam como por ejemplo, el de mappear los controles en el mando, causando crashes y movimiento que ni hemos hecho. Si lo juegas con teclado, todo ok. Ya hace más de 2 años que no lo ponen en oferta siquiera y no se ha tocado el precio base tampoco. Seguramente valga la pena invertir 5€ en otro juego. Una pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992583533', 'num_games_owned': 3366, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1695438149}
review:
I had a lot of fun playing this game. It starts off fairly basic and easy, but the difficulty ramps up in a satisfying way. It has a bunch of different types of levels that all require different skillsets to complete. Some require you to plan your moves in advance, some require speed, some require awareness of your surroundings.

I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108067', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1606571079}
review:
Shopworn Match 3 mechanics receive a new lease on life in [i]Pushcat[/i], a cheery [i]Boulder Dash[/i] derivative brimming with attractive pixel art and goofy dialogue.  Players assist the indomitable title character as he travels through various worlds in search of gems which yield smiling silver coins.  When three or more gems of the same colour are matched horizontally or vertically they transform into the coins, much to the delight of the covetous cat.  After a set number of coins are collected, Pushcat can escape through the catflap and proceed to the next area.  Although Pushcat can become trapped or reduced to ashes by exploding Aztec Death-heads and have no choice but to restart the level, he never needs to worry about being crushed from above by falling blocks; this element makes the gameplay far less tedious than that of many [i]Boulder Dash[/i] imitators.  Most levels require some degree of planning, but every once in a while there are more freeform, endurance-focused trials where Pushcat simply needs to stay alive while pocketing a larger number of coins.

[i]Pushcat[/i] boasts numerous chiptune renditions of notable ragtime and classical pieces (The list of featured works is conveniently located in the credits scroll).  The soundtrack eschews Scott Joplin tunes in favour of slightly lesser-known pieces from the ragtime repertoire, and they're all quite perky.  The intense Baba Yaga segment from Mussorgsky's [i]Pictures at an Exhibition[/i] is effectively employed in the levels where Pushcat encounters the cumbersome but dangerous ghost who seeks to put an end to his silver hunting, and there's a vivacious arrangement of Chopin's [i]Étude Op. 25 No. 1[/i] as well.

[i]Boulder Dash[/i] fans will appreciate this nicely presented, moderately challenging puzzle adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117580168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1706369349}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1595946410}
review:
This is a weird hybrid of Sokoban, Boulderdash and Bejewelled.  Push blocks around and let them fall until you match three coloured gems together.

The concept has some traction but the developers lacked the budget/talent to capitalise on it.  The game features ugly retro pixel graphics, due to lack of capability from the developer to include higher production values.  The developer also was inexplicably unable to make the game work properly in 16:9, so it was developed with a 4:3 ratio, despite being made in 2015.  Resolution is fixed and can't be changed, so the game falls far beneath the minimum quality standard for PC.

review:
https://youtu.be/fIdoFEnIPJw

Ever seeking silver, 'Pushcat' is a puzzle game that mixes 'Columns' and 'Boulder Dash' into the same formula and throws in a few of it's own new mechanics along the way.  This turns out to be a fun and challenging mix that will challenge players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196828453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1527504515}
review: Интерестная и в то же время сложная игра. Играешь за 8 битного кота которые как пакман. Ну реально. Русского языка в игре нет,но он туда нужен.Конечно вы подумаете зачем покупить 8 битную игру в стиме, когда можно скачать пиратку. НООО карточки не дешёвые. 15 руб за одну. Также там красивые фоны, если собрать 6-8 карточек(я просто не помню), итого будет 90-120 рублей.Но я их продал бы, но не в этой жизни...

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1495678234}
review:
Tags: Casual - Match 3
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Odd digging/2D physics oriented match3 with sokoban twist. Difficulty due to unintuitive mechanics. Play Puyo Puyo Tetris or Steamworld Dig instead.

This is basically supermotherload or steamworld dig, limited to only one screen, in which you must clear the screens and raise score by digging under gems, having them match 3, and avoiding death. It is very easy to screw up or trap yourself in a corner. Gets tedious and fast due to finnicky nature of the core gameplay. Leading to an irritating gameplay loop.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/571310/SteamWorld_Dig_2/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/546050/Puyo_PuyoTetris/

author: {'steamid': '76561198023788861', 'num_games_owned': 2551, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1446169588}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014519305', 'num_games_owned': 2431, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1482781301}
review:
7/10

This is a nice little puzzle game. The gameplay is in the style of old Boulder Dash and some of the puzzles are really tricky without being cruel. Overall a well executed idea with cute graphics.

Would have had an extra point off me but I had to spend 45 minutes or so after I'd "completed" it clicking to restart 999 times to get the last couple of achievements. I HATE when devs put stupid and pointless achievements that are not gameplay related in there to pad them out. There were so many cool other achievement ideas they could have used.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118616963', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1480038961}
review: Even when the graphics are not that appealing, the game is good enough to keep me entertained. When I first see a new puzzle it seems quite simple, but it requires in fact some time to solve it. In order to advance/unlock a level you require to get a fixated amount of coins, once you do, the door opens and you can move forward. I enjoy three-match games and this one, while not too challenging nor too easy, gives me a good time whenever I play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040534565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1467002133}
review:
What I like about it: reminds me of Boulder Dash, except things don't kill you when they fall on you, and you can push multiple objects (not just one).

What's give-or-take for me: it's a match-three.  Not exactly my favorite style of puzzle, though it puts an interesting spin on the Boulder Dash-like gameplay.

What I don't like: some sections of puzzles are randomized.

Still, if you can snag it for cheap, I say go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1657, 'last_played': 1459450664}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Аркадная головоломка в, которой нам предстоит примерить на себе шкурку фиолетового котика, который путешествует по разным опасным пещерам. На каждом уровне нашей задачей будет собрать определенное количество монет, чтобы открылся люк с переходом на следующий уровень. Чтобы получить монеты нам нужно будет двигая различные формы кубов собрать драгоценные камни - три в ряд. Но не все так просто, каждый уровень сделан так, что необходимо включать голову по полной, ведь если сделать неверный шаг, то можно смело переигрывать, а также не стоит забывать, о том, что на большинстве уровней за нами будет гоняться злая приведенька, которая очень сильно хочет нас сцапать. Заучить уровни невозможно, ведь каждый раз расстановка кубов генерируется по новой и от этого становится в разы интереснее.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ В большинстве уровней кубы генерируются каждый раз по разному.
¥ Интересные неповторяющиеся уровни.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Нет русского языка (только меню перевести и вводную о кубах)
¥ Нет абсолютно никакого сюжета.

[h1]Достижения:[/h1]
В игре есть простые для выполнения достижения которые выполняются за одно полное прохождение игры. Но к концу игры остаются два достижения которые нужно делать на автомате. Например нажать рестарт 999 раз, к концу игры на 50 звезд, у меня было нажато менее половины и пришлось запускать процесс на скрипте.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Приятная и интересная головоломка, в которой смело можно провести несколько вечеров. Однозначно рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании

author: {'steamid': '76561198160143776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1454201688}
review:
Pushcat is a great game!!
The game is very addicting! 
It is a different kind of match 3 game because you have to plan your moves and use different strategies to win the games within levels. You get coins after you match 3 or more gems but then you have to go back and collect the coins which is easier said than done. You can play a game (cave) a few times and then realize what you need to do to beat it! There are 50 caves to beat, they are all different, some have a few gems some have hundreds of gems.
There is no time limit and you can replay the cave till you win it!
It's a great puzzle solving game along with a match 3 game!

I love it! 
I recommend this game! 
I'd buy it again 
:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989183393', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1449604194}
review:
Even though the screenshots and video on the store page does an excellent job of showing what this game is like, I was quite positively surpised of how fun this little game is. It's a combination between 25% Boulder Dash and 75% Bejeweled.

It has quite some levels and quite some variation between the 5 worlds available. It starts out almost too easy, but quickly becomes harder and harder, and some levels are just evil IMO.

But overall a fun little puzzle game, for a quite acceptable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993612995', 'num_games_owned': 10322, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1560171036}
review:
Un buen juego de puzzles que resulta una especie de cruce de Boulder Dash y Bejeweled. Tu objetivo es empujar filas de bloques para alinear joyas del mismo color y conseguir bastantes diamantes para salir del nivel (o unos cuantos más para conseguir una estrella) sin quedarte atrapado. Al principio resulta muy fácil y basta con conseguir entender lo que hay que hacer para despejar el nivel, pero luego se va complicando (con una curva de dificultad muy bien graduada) a la par que añade alguna nueva mecánica de vez en cuando. La estética es de 8 bits, con gráficos y sonidos ochenteros (de los creíbles, no idealizados en plan "cool"), y está tan bien diseñado que te imaginas perfectamente jugando al mismo juego en un Amstrad CPC o cualquier ordenador modesto de aquella época.

En definitiva, lo recomiendo sin reservas a los amantes de lo retro y los buenos juegos de puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105344474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1449323319}
review: This game has hint of tetris where you push and match 3 in a row to gain silver to unlock the next level. This is unlike other match 3 where it is a puzzle as planning is need before making decision as it can cause irreversible consequences. This game can get pretty confusing and difficult as more colours are introduced and pitfall that consume any block that fell in. This is not a speed game where you try to clear the level fast but more of a puzzle solving game. Overall it is appealing and different from normal match 3 that can be too similiar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013914001', 'num_games_owned': 1996, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1447799895}
review:
*Ganhei a chave em um giveaway do orlgyft*

Usando apenas as setas direcionais você move um gato (macabramente) sorridente e empurra pedras coloridas pelo cenário. O objetivo é simples e pouco original: Junte 3 pedras de mesma cor e elas viram moedas para coletar. Uma mecânica trivial, com infinitas possibilidades. 
Não há botão 'desfazer' e um movimento errado pode causar uma reação em cadeia e ferrar todo o jogo. Como em uma partida de xadrez você simula movimentos mentalmente tentando medir suas consequências. Acaba descobrindo/inventando truques para resolver certas situações, como pedras de mesma cor na diagonal de um quadrado 3x3, ou pedras na quina do mapa...etc. Achei o jogo bem divertido. Mas adiante no jogo é exigido cada vez mais reflexos e novos elementos vão sendo adicionados. As fases são bem diversificadas e cada uma exige uma estratégia diferente. Os gráficos são pixelados, como podem notar. A música é tosca, no estilo jogo 8bits e não sai da cabeça haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075318915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1446974403}
review:
[h1]Puzzle Game im Retro-lock  für Kinder ab 12 Jahren[/h1]

Pushcat ist ein wirklich niedliches Puzzle-game, mit ansteigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad. Die Story ist schnell erzählt: die Katze "Pushcat" steigt in Höhlen um Silber zu finden. Es wird einem kein Ziel vorgesetzt, so das durch die Geschichte leider keine Spielmotivation entstehen kann.

Die Grafik ist einfach gehalten im Lock eines Atari, ich würde jeden den Farbblindenmodus empfehlen, da durch diesen ein bisschen Abwechslung, was die Form der Edelsteine angeht, ins Spiel kommt.

Das einfache Spielprinzip ermöglicht es einen schnell ein zu steigen, durch den steigenden Schwierigkeitsgrad wird es nicht langweilig und dadurch das man ein "Sterne-System" eingebaut hat, wird man dazu animiert, das eine oder andere Level noch einmal zu spielen,damit man endlich auch dort den Stern abgestaubt hat 
Da in diesem Spiel, sterben nicht möglich ist, kommt nur Frust auf, wenn man sich selber in eine Sackgasse gebuddelt hat.

Der Sound ist passend und gut gewählt, die Musik ist zwar kein Meisterwerk, aber flott und witzig. Mir selber wurde die Musik auch nach mehrmaligen hören nicht langweilig, jedoch kann ich mir vorstellen, das sie auf Dauer langweilig wird, wie es mit anderen Musikstücken aussieht, kann ich leider nicht sagen, da ich nicht über die 1. Welt hinaus gespielt habe.

Das Spiel lässt sich einfach Steuern, bugs habe ich während meiner Spielzeit keine entdeckt und alles in allem scheint es ein schönes kleines Spiel zu sein.

Alles in allem empfinde ich das Spiel als gelungen, das einzige Manko ist die Geschichte, wenn diese einen triftigen Grund liefern würde, weshalb man das Spiel durchspielen sollte, weshalb man die Sterne sammeln sollte, würde es deutlich an Spielspass gewinnen.

Zusammenfassung:
Typ: Retro-Puzzlespiel
Musik: 7/10
Sound: 7/10
Grafik: 8/10
Bedienung: 10/10
Meinung: 6/10
Gesammt: 7,5/10

Fazit:
Ein nettes Spiel, mit einer schwachen Story. 
Für Leute die Steamkarten sammeln jedoch durchaus empfehlenswert, da man leicht an diese herankommt.

review: Простенькая, но в то же время очень добротная игра.  Принцип простой: нужно собрать драгоценные камни, либо коробки в ряд, минимум 3 штуки. Изюминка в том, что все объекты толкает кот. На определенных уровнях даже имеются враги, от которых нужно убегать и, при этом, успевать собирать в ряд всё те же камни или коробки. В целом - впечатление от игры весьма не плохое. Скоротать время - самое оно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100856137', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1446089167}
review:
[h1]Received free copy.[/h1]

[Graphics - good]: It's a personal preference but I'm a sucker for retro or other 2D graphic styles and it's a puzzle game so the reason you're here is for the puzzles not the graphics... plus Pushcat is just so darn cute you can't really hate him.

[Sound - good]: I love the music, it's like 8bit ragtime style music. The sound affects are fitting but basic.

[Difficulty - average]: I can't really rate or comment on this since I haven't gotten too far into the higher levels. The beginning is easy enough but apparently later on you get pressured by the ghosts and other obstacles that pop up to get in your way.

[Gameplay - average]: If you don't what a match 3 game is you must be new on teh interwebz.

[Overall - average]: It's hard to recommend or not recommend this game when there are so many other match 3 clones out there for much less, $5 is a lot for this kind of game which really works best as a time-killer more than a full game. If you see it on sale though why not grab it, you could do far worse. I'll recommend it just for the adorable purple cat. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561197993891197', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1472083274}
review:
Pushcat is what you get when you cross Bejeweled with Boulder Dash. Interestingly, the game specifically draws inspiration from the NES version of Boulder Dash, which I have something of an irrational love for after I spent most of my childhood playing it.

The mechanics are very simple: you need to collect a quota of silver coins from each level, but first you need to create the coins by pushing and dropping colored gems into rows of three. Later, there are some other ways that coins are created, as well as some other mechanics like blobs that eat rocks and bombs that destroy walls under certain circumstances. If you collect the coin quota and exit, you can progress to other levels, but you can also aim for a “star” quota on most levels by collecting even more coins. There are about fifty levels in all.

The game has many random elements. Some levels are completely random, others are generated based on a fixed template, but the specific contents of the level will change every time it's reloaded. Naturally, the random elements will occasionally screw you over, but for the most part it works as an interesting challenge feature.

But here’s the problem: about halfway through the game, there's a fearsome difficulty spike, and it basically becomes a masochism game. Ghosts will chase you, bombs will blow you up, puzzles will become super strict, and gem quotas will be so steep that you'll need to really stretch your brain about how you tackle a level and where you push things. Levels can get really long and it may take up to ten minutes just to set up a level correctly to produce the gems you need, especially for star quotas. There is no rewinding, and so dropping one gem in the wrong place could mean you need to start the whole level over again. You might also get caught by a ghost, blown up by a bomb, or trapped between rocks and need to restart. The final boss level can only be described as torture. On a positive note, there are no time limits to be seen, except when the level design creates them.

There’s also no leaderboards, extra levels, level editor, or anything else to encourage replay once you’ve collected all of the stars. At the end of the journey, game certainly feels like it's missing something.

Although I personally enjoyed this game, I can't recommend it to the majority of puzzle gamers. It's not an easy 100% for achievement hunters, and it's probably going to be a bit too far on the frustrating side for most people. If you really love Boulder Dash-type games and you’re okay with a challenge, you might like it as much as I did. Otherwise, there isn’t a lot to appeal to the average player or ease them into the genre, and you might wind up finding a bit too much to hate about it instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1445496500}
review:
5min of this game
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6B32fC89TQA

this is a puzzle match 3 game.
you need X coins to beat a level and/or get a star (stars unlock new areas).
you get coins by matching 3 like blocks of the same color, exploding some blocks, or sometimes they are just laying around a board but there are other blocks around that obstruct you.
most are puzzle like boards (figure out how to match all the blocks), but there are some where you just push blocks around or collect coins that are relatively easy to break up gameplay, also there are boss levels where a ghost will chase you around while you try and complete a level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994894769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1553809365}
review:
Arcade block pusher + match 3 with charming pixel/chip style.

(In the trailer, the camera pans around segments of several boards from the game, but in actual gameplay each whole level is fully visible when you play it)

Pushcat matches up colored gems to turn them into coins, collects coins to unlock the exit. Action & movement are similar to classics like Dig-Dug, Mr. Do, and Boulder Dash. Pushcat can move freely in 4 directions, but blocks & coins will fall down until they either land on a surface or fall off the board. In addition to pushable gems and junk blocks, there are stationary wall blocks and diggable tiles.

Each level has a coin quota you must reach in order to unlock the exit (as well as an optional higher quota to earn a "star" rating for the level), and most levels offer a limited supply of gems with which to create those coins. The trick lies in planning your moves so that you can make enough matches without getting stuck. There's no hard time limit, but some levels feature a ghost which will move slowly toward Pushcat, ignoring walls.

Some of the block matching reminds me of Tetris Attack (or Puzzle League/Panel de Pon, whichever). Sometimes you're moving back and forth to drop blocks down a chasm, other times you're pushing a foundation of blocks in order to transport a few on top.

I really like this game, but there are two intentional features that I don't fully appreciate: 

-In many levels, the music is sort of incomplete - some instruments won't kick in until you reach your coin minimum. I actually like when games play around with the instrument tracks like this, I just wish it didn't take until the exit opened for the effect to take place. You really only hear these songs fully when you stick around to try to earn a bonus star.

-You have to push and hold against a block for a bit before it actually moves. There are very good reasons for this delay: You pretty much can't accidentally push a block (important, as there's no "undo", only "restart"). On top of that, allowing you to push blocks with no delay would likely allow you to intercept falling blocks. This would have puzzle-breaking potential. There are times when I let go too early because I misjudge the delay, and I have to go back and push again. Yes, this is my own error, but I feel like making the delay a bit shorter would help this somewhat.


Still, those two minor gripes considered, this is a fun arcadey puzzle game. Give it a try.

Mussorgsky/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026123571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1561926454}
review:
It's the thing to get, if your some kind of cute-game-loving, block-match-enjoying weirdo like me. 

Sufficiently lenient  with the number of moves you're allowed to screw up, but no so much as to become trivial and unchallenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420790', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 399, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1437763328}
review:
This game would be a great puzzle game if not for the ghost levels (Ooky Spooky world). The ghost ruins the game. It's not even that hard to avoid, you just have to avoid the ghost most of the time whilst trying to do the normal puzzle-solving stuff, and all you have to do is wait in a corner to lure it there, then run to the other side. And this wastes huge amounts of time, so I often found myself failing to the ghost not out of difficulty, but mistakes made via boredom and frustration at having to wait around so much.

So due to the ghost I never finished Ooky Spooky world without a vile cheat, which is a shame.

The music's pretty entertaining as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996921477', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1436347296}
review:
Bei PushCat handelt es sich um ein klassisches Puzzelspiel, in welchem man die Farben der Steine sortieren muss, indem man die steine verschiebt. Das Spiel erinnert musikalisch und grafisch an gloreiche SNES-Zeiten und macht durch das simple Prinzip spaß.

Wer gerne auf Puzzelspiele steht, kann hier unbedenklich zugreifen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1434719816}
review:
自キャラは上下左右自由に動けて土を自在に掘削出来て
石や宝石は支えを失えば落下するので生き埋めを防ぎつつ
目標金額を稼いで無事出口まで戻れたらクリアっていう
身も蓋もない言い方をするとバルダーダッシュの派生ゲー

ただし宝石は同色の物を縦か横に三個以上並べて
コインに変化させてから回収しないと収入にならない
お陰でコインになった後も石や宝石に埋もれて
掘り起こし作業が必要だったりしてよく出来てる

ステージが進むごとに特性の違う新ブロックが投入され
単なる亜種で終わらないところは好感がもてる


ただパズルゲームの癖にランダムで吐き出される
ブロックをアドリブで捌くアクションステージが
後半ちょいちょい混じってるのはどうなんだろう

ラストステージもその口で、成否を左右するのが
運が七割、腕が三割で頭はほぼ必要ないって……

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1426850634}
review:
[h1]Pushcat est un jeu excellent s’inspirant de Boulder Dash et des match 3[/h1]

Pushcat est un petit jeu (sans aucune connotation négative) composé de 60 niveaux.

Vous jouez un chat violet avec une bande rose en son milieu qui a le talent de pousser les pierres et les cristaux.

Votre objectif à travers les différents niveaux est d’assembler des cristaux de même couleur ensemble. Il en faut au minimum trois mais plus, ça peut fonctionner aussi. Voici l’inspiration pour les match 3.

Pushcat évolue sur des tableaux où il doit creuser, pousser, tirer, fuir, réfléchir, souffler, hurler, jouer ... (je crois que les derniers verbes ne sont pas bons, je me laisse emporter) pour permettre aux cristaux de se toucher. Voilà pour le côté Boulder Dash.

A la différence de Boulder Dash, les pierres ne sont pas des menaces pour Pushcat. Attention, cela ne veut pas dire qu’il n’y a pas de menaces !

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=417689453

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/03/21/test-pushcat-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire l'ensemble de mes impressions sur Pushcat.[/url]

review: Great, addictive game. Soundtrack reminds me of Super Mario. Easy enough at first but definitely includes some enjoyable brainteasers. Plus, the ghost looks like the school of fish from Finding Nemo.

review: Surprisingly good! The mechanics are fairly simple, but the puzzles get increasingly harder (but not to the point of frustration).  I have a soft spot for puzzle games in which you play a character (Wario's Woods, Super Puzzle Platformer, etc.) and this is a good little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046285197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1445064364}
review:
remember boulderdash series? i loved those games and have looked for something like that and i think i found it

you play as a cat who needs to find coins to unlock the catdoor, its match 3 concept however in a boulderdash kind of way you push stuff around to match gems the gems turn into coins and coins open the door very simple but amazingly deep gameplay 

forget about graphics this is a pure gameplay game i give it 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7466, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1445101721}
review:
This is a pretty solid little puzzle game, and I actually bought and beat it a few years back out of interest in the concept. I highly recommend it!

THAT SAID.

There are two types of levels in the game. Some are hand-made and thus have a set style of solution (with mild flexibility). These are perfectly okay. The other, though, are entirely procedurally generated beyond "there is a gem/rock/dirt in this square", and thus it will change details every time you reset.

Those levels? Not so good. Unless you reset every time you begin, you won't see them coming, and they can go from "Well, this is doable" and you'll never notice, to "having made 3 'wrong' moves the stage is now mathematically impossible, and you won't know until the very end". It's hard to explain without having played it, but basically, this can turn a stage from "you need to consider every move" to "I pushed a gem and half of the level cleared itself before I did anything" ALL WITH THE SPAWN OF THE STAGE. These are the biggest flaw on Pushcat, and the best part about it is that unless you want to clear every level with a star, you can skip them or fake it with just a stage clear.

But if you enjoy the game, like me, you're probably going to go for those stars, and god have mercy on your soul when you hit a procedurally generated stage.

(Other notes: the music is incredibly fun, being a very early cartoon/calliope style, with different layers of the song appearing as you clear the stage to various degrees. Also, some of the premade stages are incredibly clever and I wish the Steam release added new levels or something.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999363278', 'num_games_owned': 3013, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1421477626}
review: Sokoban + DigDug. Pretty damn good and entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106814416', 'num_games_owned': 1878, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1481393522}
review:
Avec de très bonnes idées de puzzle, que ce soient prises indépendamment ou combinées, Pushcat est une excellente surprise avec une durée de vie frôlant la dizaine d'heures ! Une difficulté intéressante pour créer le challenge et donner envie de continuer, une organisation intelligente des niveaux pour ne pas rester bloqué et des événements en début de puzzle pour bien saisir les nouveautés du gameplay, Pushcat est un jeu d'action/réflexion très réussi. On regrettera néanmoins tout ce qui touche à l'audio qui deviendra rapidement insupportable et forcera le joueur à couper musiques et bruitages depuis les options.

Lire le test complet : http://www.indiemag.fr/tests/pushcat-la-reflexion-motivante

author: {'steamid': '76561197965860870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1445159851}
review:
Pushcat is a match 3 game, with digdug elements.

You match gems to produce enough coins for you to progress, but its often not that simple due to the terrain and level design.


Well worth your time if you like match three games.
